results.title: What is a reptile?
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Describes four orders of reptiles and discusses their physical characteristics, reproductive processes and their evolutionary development. Discusses reasons for the successful evolution and survival of the reptile. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Army ants: a study in social behaviour
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film depicts two species of army ants in the Panama Canal zone. It presents the basic structure of an ant colony and the behaviour of the ants and shows evidence of stimuli which influence their behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Kid
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Christina Steinberg, Hunt Lowry, Junction Entertainment and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Bruce Willis plays Russ Duritz, an emotionally detached image consultant who is a winner in business, but a loser in all other areas of his life, especially in regards to his interpersonal skills. Upon meeting Rusty (a ten year old version of himself) Russ starts to reshape himself into a more humane being, partly by revisiting, understanding, and even altering, his past. Cast also includes Spencer Breslin, Emily Mortimer, Lily Tomlin, Chi McBride, Jean Smart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jon Turteltaub, Christina Steinberg, Hunt Lowry, Junction Entertainment and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: The Single-celled animals: protozoa
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film illustrates the characteristics and behaviour of representatives of each class of protozoans. It demonstrates the processes of digestion and reproduction, and discusses theories of protozoan evolution from ancient single-celled plants. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Social insects: the honeybee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Shows how social insects live in colonies and divide into castes. Illustrates the particular adaptation of the various castes in relation to reproduction, populatin control and food gathering. Shows the metamorphosis of a honey-bee from egg to adult.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Shows how social insects live in colonies and divide into castes. Illustrates the particular adaptation of the various castes in relation to reproduction, populatin control and food gathering. Shows the metamorphosis of a honey-bee from egg to adult.

results.title: Echinoderms: sea stars and their relatives
results.brief_description:
Episode of series “Biology program. Unit 3. Animal life”
Describes the characteristics of the echinoderm body plan and shows how it adapted for locomotion, respiration, digestion and reproduction. Includes examples of the five classes of echinodeerms.
Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of series “Biology program. Unit 3. Animal life”

Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Biology program; unit 3. Animal life
results.brief_description: Series of programs intended for upper secondary level students. Introduces the study of animal life and provides examples of structure, life cycle, behavior and adaptation of various animal groups, eg amphibians, mammals, reptiles etc.

results.title: What is an amphibian?
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film illustrates the body structure and life process of amphibians and shows their adaptation to life in water and on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Karate kid. Part 2
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen and Jerry Weintraub
results.brief_description: Karate kid, Daniel travels to Japan with his teacher, Miyagi, to visit Miyagi’s dying father. It’s a troubled trip for Daniel and his teacher as Miyagi returns to face his sworn enemy. Daniel becomes involved in the hate-ridden vendetta and whereas before he fought in a contest where a trophy was at stake, Daniel now plays a game that’s a fight to the death.

results.title: What is a fish
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Illustrates the major types of fish showing the anatomy of a typical fish, behaviour patterns such as commensalism, spawning, predation and territoriality.
